theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE formation, accumulation, RAGE receptor signaling, and inflammation as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes non-enzymatic protein glycation leading to AGE accumulation and inflammation contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links glycation byproducts like methylglyoxal to AGE formation, metabolic disruption, and systemic aging effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE accumulation in brain causing proteostasis disruption and neuronal damage via inflammatory pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes AGE accumulation in long-lived proteins and their biochemical effects including receptor-mediated inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGE cross-linking of arterial wall proteins and RAGE signaling cause arterial stiffening and vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGE accumulation in lens proteins with genetic and environmental factors influencing glycation-related tissue damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights endogenous and dietary AGE formation and their causal role in aging and chronic diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes protein glycation and carbonyl stress leading to AGE accumulation and aging-related damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on pentosidine crosslinks formed by glycation in collagen contributing to tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Maillard reaction leading to AGE formation and accumulation causing protein crosslinking and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGE accumulation as a marker and causal factor in aging with inverse correlation to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGE accumulation in lens tissue correlates with aging and protein crosslinking.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Dietary sucrose influences AGE accumulation causing protein crosslinking and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGEs upregulate elastase activity via receptor signaling, promoting extracellular matrix degradation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGE accumulation in hippocampal neurons contributes to brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Pentosidine crosslink formation via glycation and oxidation contributes to protein damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGEP accumulation in aging and Alzheimer’s disease links glycation to neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: AGE formation and RAGE interaction cause oxidative stress and inflammation driving aging-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Intracellular glycation causes protein damage; FN3K enzyme mitigates glycation, linking to aging and diabetes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Accumulation and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Decline of glyoxalase detox system increases methylglyoxal and AGE accumulation, promoting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Carbonyl and Oxidative Stress-Mediated Cross-Linking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates free radical and glycation theories via carbonyl chemistry causing protein cross-linking and lipofuscin formation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Carbonyl and Oxidative Stress-Mediated Cross-Linking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Nonenzymatic post-translational modifications including glycation and carbamylation compete to modify matrix proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Carbonyl and Oxidative Stress-Mediated Cross-Linking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Non-enzymic PTMs such as glycation, carbamylation, oxidation accumulate with age causing protein dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Carbonyl and Oxidative Stress-Mediated Cross-Linking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Formaldehyde-induced protein cross-linking via Maillard reaction contributes to systemic aging and protein dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thiyl Radical-Mediated Hydrophobic Cross-Linking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Thiyl radical formation in mitochondrial membrane proteins causes hydrophobic cross-links impairing longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Transglutaminase-Mediated Enzymatic Crosslinking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Age-related increase in transglutaminase C activity causes enzymatic crosslinking of cellular and extracellular proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Transglutaminase-Mediated Enzymatic Crosslinking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Transglutaminase crosslinks core histones altering chromatin and promoting cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Connective Tissue Collagen Crosslinking and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Age-related collagen crosslinking and stabilization alter mechanical properties of connective tissues.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Connective Tissue Collagen Crosslinking and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connective tissue aging involves ECM protein modifications including glycation and altered cell-matrix interactions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Connective Tissue Collagen Crosslinking and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Advanced Maillard reaction products like vesperlysine A accumulate in lens proteins causing crosslinking and cataract.
